Comment: As much as I hate to do it, I'm annotating all of my games, even the bad ones. So here's a bad one. Team match, one of four games I started against this same player (two matches) on 1/19/2009. I'm black and play the Sicilian.

As much as I hate to do it, I'm annotating all of my games, even the bad ones. So here's a bad one. Team match, one of four games I started against this same player (two matches) on 1/19/2009. I'm black and play the Sicilian.

White has thrown me for a loop with 3. c3. I don't have any chess library to speak of, and this move isn't in what I have. So I'm winging it with the GK DB for now. Edit: Note that now black's knight attacks the white pawn on e4, but if black captures it, say with 4. ... Nxe4?, white replies 5. Qa4+ and 6. Qxe5 and black loses his knight.

OK, down two pieces but up by 4 pawns, 3 of which are passed. Maybe this can still work. Except 20. Bb4? was probably not a good way to start off.

Fact is, I'm pretty much done for. I am hoping to trade everything off in such a way that white has to sacrifice a piece to stop the promotion. That would leave black with two pawns for a piece. One more promotion threat, one more sacrifice, and black is up a pawn. Yeah, not gonna happen, but maybe if I can threaten it, or if my opponent makes a mistake along the way, I can still get a draw, or a lucky win out of it. Maybe. Worth playing on to find out.

Yeah, I could play this on for 30 or so more moves, but two pawns against two pieces is a losing deal. I have better games to spend my time analyzing. By better, I mean games I'm not throwing away - my opponent played this game very well.
